title: كَمْ الاسْتِفْهَامِيَّة وَالخَبَرِيَّة
description: Learn about the two types of كَمْ in Arabic: كَمْ الاستفهامية (interrogative - How many?) and كَمْ الخبرية (informative - so many!), including their different grammatical rules for تمييز.

notes.title: Introduction to كَمْ
content: كَمْ is an indeclinable noun (اسْمٌ مَبْنِيٌّ) that indicates quantity. It has two distinct usages in Arabic: interrogative (استفهامية) asking about quantity, and informative/exclamatory (خبرية) expressing abundance.
Both types of كَمْ require a تمييز (specifier noun) after them, but the grammatical case of this تمييز differs significantly between the two types.
Understanding the difference between these two types is essential for correct Arabic grammar and proper interpretation of classical texts including the Quran.
keyPoints: كَمْ is an indeclinable noun (مَبْنِيٌّ عَلَى السُّكُونِ)
It always requires a تمييز (specifier) after it
The grammatical case of تمييز differs between the two types

examples.english: How many books did you read? (interrogative)
So many books I have read! (informative)
How many students are in the classroom?
How many blessings Allah has bestowed upon us!

notes.title: Interrogative كَمْ
content: كَمْ الاستفهامية is used to ask questions about quantity or number. It is equivalent to 'How many?' or 'How much?' in English.
The تمييز (specifier) after كَمْ الاستفهامية must be singular (مُفْرَد) and in the accusative case (مَنْصُوب). This is similar to the numbers 11-99 in Arabic.
The answer to a question with كَمْ الاستفهامية should include a specific number.
keyPoints: Used to ask about quantity: 'How many?'
Requires a question mark in modern punctuation

examples.english: How many days did you fast?
How many hours did you study?
How many riyals did you pay?
How many times did you visit Mecca?

notes.title: Informative/Exclamatory كَمْ
content: كَمْ الخبرية is used to express abundance or large quantity without asking a question. It conveys meaning similar to 'So many!' or 'How many!' (exclamatory) in English.
The تمييز after كَمْ الخبرية is in the genitive case (مَجْرُور). It can be singular or plural, though singular is more common.
Often, the particle مِنْ is inserted between كَمْ الخبرية and its تمييز, especially when the تمييز is plural. This مِنْ is زائدة (additional/emphatic).
keyPoints: تمييز can be singular or plural
مِنْ may be added: كَمْ مِنْ كِتَابٍ

examples.english: So many books I have read!

examples.arabic: كَمْ مِنْ فِئَةٍ قَلِيلَةٍ غَلَبَتْ فِئَةً كَثِيرَةً
examples.english: How many small groups have overcome large groups!
How many blessings of Allah are upon you!
How many a town We have destroyed! (Quran)

notes.title: كَمْ in the Quran
content: كَمْ appears in the Quran in both its interrogative and informative forms, providing excellent examples of classical Arabic usage.
The Quranic usage demonstrates the informative كَمْ particularly well, often with the particle مِنْ to emphasize the abundance or multitude being described.
Studying these Quranic examples helps learners understand the rhetorical power of كَمْ الخبرية in expressing Allah's power and the lessons of history.
keyPoints: Both types appear in the Quran
كَمْ الخبرية is often used for historical examples
مِنْ is commonly used with كَمْ الخبرية in Quran
Context determines if كَمْ is interrogative or informative

examples.arabic: كَمْ مِنْ فِئَةٍ قَلِيلَةٍ غَلَبَتْ فِئَةً كَثِيرَةً بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ
examples.english: How many a small group has overcome a large group by the permission of Allah (2:249)

examples.arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ بَطِرَتْ مَعِيشَتَهَا
examples.english: And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its living (28:58)
And how many a generation We destroyed before them (19:74)
How much they left behind of gardens and springs (44:25)

exercises.promptEn: How many _____ are in the month?
How many a _____ Allah has destroyed!
How many _____ of Allah are upon us!
How many _____ did you study today?

exercises.prompt: How many students are in the class?
How many times did you visit the mosque?
So many blessings Allah has given us!
How many books are on the shelf?
